If you are ever able to allocate the spot to me, I can confirm acceptance immediately and complete enrollment paperwork the same day.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued patience and for trying to plan ahead.

1) We do not have a single, fixed “event” that automatically releases the place beyond the higher-priority group. In general terms, the only circumstances that would change our position are if the allocation process is formally closing/finalizing (or we receive explicit direction from the coordinating authority/administration to finalize placements with the best available eligible family at that time). Until such a direction/closure occurs, we must keep the place available in case a higher-priority family applies.

2) We cannot pre-authorize an offer or accept pre-submitted documents in a way that would reserve the place. However, to help you be ready, the standard items we would typically request at the point an offer can be made include: proof of child identity/age, parent/guardian ID, contact and emergency details, immunization/health information as required, and start-date/schedule confirmation (and any other standard local enrollment forms). If our position changes and we are able to make an offer, we would request the required items immediately and proceed as quickly as possible.

We understand you are ready to accept immediately; at this time, though, we still cannot commit to a timeline or any standby release while the process remains open.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions
